Line 2: Start Point - (0.7326, 0.0), End Point - (0.7326, 0.0432). 3. Line 3: Start Point - (0.7326, 0.0432), End Point - (0.0835, 0.0432). 4. This sketch consists of a single face, which in turn has a single loop made up of three lines. 1. Line 1: Start Point - (0.7326, 0.0), End Point - (0.75, 0.0). 2. Line 2: Start Point - (0.75, 0.0), End Point - (0.7326, 0.0432). 3. Line 3: Start Point - (0.7326, 0.0432), End Point - (0.7326, 0.0). Scale the combined sketches by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled sketches into 3D sketches using the coordinate system information. Extrude the scaled and transformed sketches to a depth of 0.0432 units towards the positive normal direction and 0 units in the opposite direction. Use sketch scaling when extruding. Perform a 'New Body Feature Operation' with the current part and any preceding models. The final extruded part should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.0432 units - Height: 0.5 units</description>
